abstract: Group of Seattle residents files suit against city, contending practice of checking residents' garbage for improperly sorted recyclables is violation of privacy as protected in Washington State Constitution; at issue is whether items can be considered private after they are thrown away and whether proportions of mis-sorted items can be accurately calculated.
lead_paragraph: In a lawsuit filed Thursday, a group of Seattle residents said the city’s garbage inspection rules violated their privacy rights.

headline.main: Residents Sue Seattle, Saying New Trash Rules Violate Privacy
headline.print_headline: Residents’ Suit Against Seattle Says Trash Rules Violate Privacy

snippet: In a lawsuit filed Thursday, a group of Seattle residents said the city’s garbage inspection rules violated their privacy rights.
